column4: I pretty much have screwed over my ubuntu by attempting to upgrade cairo
I attempted an install from a debian deb after removing the old version
then proceeded to install a new version of libc which it depends on
and now pretty much synaptic wants to delete everything on teh system to remove the new version of libc...
yeah, pretty retarded
I mean, I thought linux package stuff was good.  This is plain orrible
yeah i know warbo - I did that to remove the old cairo
godamnit, now both my windows and linux is bricked
how would i do that?
answer yes when it says do you want to install the new lib6
you tried to remove libc6? for that yes it will try to remove everything
- no, i installed a new one
yeah it will try to remove everything or upgrade it as necessary
well the upgrade the libc6 upgraded everything as well right?
yeah you can't JUST install libc6 ... everything else needs to be pulled along with it
- well, I'm mostly a linux noob
thats okay, the cool thing is you don't haveto phone anyone to 'reactivate' it during reinstall :)
all in learning
if your anoob and don't want to futs, backup your /home and reinstall
it seems simple on the surface but the process is complicated enough that its simpler to just reinstall
not wihtout a lot of work, its far faster to reinstall
